sen.j: 神余 親綱（かなまり ちかつな、大永6年（1526年）？ - 天正8年7月2日 (旧暦)（1580年8月2日））は、戦国時代 (日本)の武将。
sen.e: Chikatsuna KANAMARI (1526?-August 2, 1580) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period.

sen.j: 越後国上杉家の旗本衆。
sen.e: He was a hatamotoshu of the Uesugi family in Echigo Province.

sen.j: 神余氏は元々上杉氏の被官で安房の国人であったが、何らかの理由で越後上杉家に仕えるようになった。
sen.e: Though the KANAMARI clan was originally the native bushi of the Province of Awa as well as hikan (low-level bureaucrat) of the Uesugi clan, he started to serve the Uesugi family in Echigo Province for some reason.

sen.j: 遅くとも親綱の祖父・神余昌綱の代から京都雑掌・外交官として重用されていた。
sen.e: He had been given important posts as Kyoto zassho and diplomat since the generation of Masatsuna KANAMARI, Chikatsuna's grandfather at the latest.

sen.cmt: He→They 「京都雑掌」定訳不明です。

sen.j: 親綱も父祖の跡を継ぎ、越後国主となった上杉謙信のもとで終始重用され続けた。
sen.e: Chikatsuna succeeded his grandfather and continued to be given important posts to serve Kenshin UESUGI who became a lord of Echigo Province.

sen.cmt: 「父祖」は父と祖父のため、父を追記

sen.j: 代官として主に京都に駐在し、朝廷や幕府との折衝の傍ら、三条西家に接近して青苧などの越後特産品の売買に関する奉行職も勤める。
sen.e: Staying mainly in Kyoto as a local governor, he also served as a bugyo (magistrate) for selling and buying local products of Echigo Province such as Aoso (fiber materials for clothing) by approaching the Sanjonishi family while he negotiated with Imperial court and bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: 青苧による取引は、長尾氏の重要な資金源となり、謙信の関東遠征を資金面で支えた。
sen.e: The transaction of Aoso became the important source of funding for the Nagao clan and financially supported Kenshin's expedition to Kanto region.

sen.j: 京都赴任中の天文 (元号)22年（1553年）の謙信上洛時には奔走の末、後奈良天皇への拝謁を成功させた。
sen.e: When Kenshin went to Kyoto in 1553 during KANAMARI's assignment in Kyoto, he succeeded in having an audience with the Emperor Gonara after struggling.

sen.j: 永禄元年（1558年）には帰京した足利義輝を祝うための使者にもなっている。
sen.e: In 1558, he also served as a messenger to celebrate Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA's return to Kyoto.

sen.j: 天正5年（1577年）には、三条城主であった山吉豊守の死去に伴う山吉家減封・転封時に三条城主として取り立てられる。
sen.e: In 1577, he was appointed to a castellan of Sanjo-jo Castle in diminishing and changing the territories of the Yamayoshi family due to the death of Toyomori YAMAYOSHI who had been a castellan of Sanjo-jo Castle.

sen.j: 御館の乱に於いては当初は木場城の山吉景長らと共に上杉景勝方に付く動きを見せたが、栃尾城主の本庄秀綱と共に上杉景虎方として参戦。
sen.e: Though he was initially about to take side with Kagekatsu UESUGI together with Kagenaga YAMAYOSHI and others in Kiba-jo Castle in Otate War, he participated in the war together with Hidetsuna HONJO, a castellan of Tochio-jo Castle on the side of Kagetora UESUGI.

sen.j: その後も景勝方の勧誘工作にも応じずに黒滝城を攻撃した。
sen.e: Later, as well, he ignored solicit deception from Kagekatsu side and attacked Kurotaki-jo Castle.

sen.j: 景虎が自刃した後も抵抗を続け、一旦は和議の調停を申し出るも決裂。
sen.e: He continued to resist even after Kagetora's suicide, and they broke down the settlement though he once extended an olive branch.

sen.j: 山吉景長が三条城内の旧臣に内応を誘い、それに応じた者により討たれた。
sen.e: He was killed by the old retainer in Sanjo-jo Castle who accepted the betrayal Kagenaga YAMAYOSHI lured.
